result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason Joseph Forrest was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Inclusive of costs.
Apply bond on file and balance through a payment plan.
STAYED for 1 year if no new charges.
Defendant to submit a DNA sample.

DE appeared.  DE to pay $50/mo comm 9-01-16.  $15 PPF added.  DE signed PPA.  Includes 15FO480, 15CM565. jaf
signed by Def & Atty this date. eif
c: Def & Atty. eif

TO ALSO INCLUDE 16CM339, 15FO480, 15CM565 and 15CM715: 
  Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Liddle. ADA:  Megan E. Kelly   DF ATTY:  Brian Thomas Smestad   DF:  Jason Joseph Forrest appeared. Case called at 8:17 a.m. Court notes this is the date and time set for a plea hearing. ADA Kelly recites agreement. Victims rights have been complied with. Atty Smestad in agreement. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads NC to Ct 1 Disorderly Conduct in 15CM565. DE pleads NC to 15FO480. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 Disorderly Conduct in 15CM565 and guilty of charge in 15FO480. On motion of the State without objecton, Crt dismisses 16CM339 and 15CM715. Sentencing arguments. DE makes statement.  

Crt orders:

In case 15FO480:

- Forfeiture in the amount of $250.00

In case 15CM565:

- Fine in the amount of $750.00 inclusive of costs. $500.00 bond to apply. DE to set up a payment plan

- Impose 60 days jail. Will stay jail time for 1 year if no new charges.

- DNA Sample
Plea hearing on July 19, 2016 at 08:00 am.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA:  Matthew L Hartung   DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski  and Atty John Kucinski DF:  Jason Joseph Forrest appeared. Case called at 9:50. Includes 15CM565, 15CM715, 15FO480 all (FPT), 16CM339 (PTC). Atty. Kucinski updates the court and believes there is no resolution. Courts cut off for ultimate negotiations will be 07-05-2016. We will follow along the the JT path with 15CM565 as #1 and 15CM715 #2.
Jury trial on July 19, 2016 at 08:00 am.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Matthew L Hartung DF ATTY: Brian Thomas Smestad DF: Jason Joseph Forrest appeared. Case called at 10:44.Set for a FPT.  Includes 15CM565, 15FO480, 15CM715. Atty. Smestad requests a JT date an offer has been extended. Cut off for negotiations will be 06-22-2016. Address confirmed. Bond continues.  Jury trial scheduled for July 19, 2016 at 08:00 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 22, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Final pre-trial at 03-29-2016 10:00 am

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Matthew L Hartung DF ATTY: Brian Thomas Smestad DF: Jason Joseph Forrest appeared. Case called at 1:04. Includes 15FO480(STC), 15CM715(PTC), 15CM565(MH). ADA Hartung updates the Court there will be no motion hearing. Atty. Smestad agrees.  Atty. Smestad needs to review the 15CM715. Court does not make a finding on the motion hearing but notes the agreement of the state not to use any statements of the DE. All files will continue with Branch 3 as hopefully a part of a global resolution. Address confirmed. Bond continues.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 29, 2016 at 10:00 am.
